caption: An absolutely one of a kind experience. Whether you are an experienced collector or just an amateur fan of pinball, this pinball collection must be among the best assembled. I count myself lucky to have had the chance to visit. If you are in Paris and appreciate games and history, experience them together and firsthand here. Email in advance to get an appointment. Well worth your time and the very fair fee.

You've got to make a reservation by emailing Raphael, but he'll treat you right and you'll likely have the whole place to yourself.  So many machines, there's no way you'll be able to play them all. Other than the Monster Bash machines, the newest machine is from 1978. So if the electromechanical machines are your bag, you'll be in heaven.  Even more interesting are the ancient machines from the 30s. They're all still playable, and so much different from pinball as most of us know it.

A truly remarkable collection of vintage pinball games, dating back to 1931. I‚Äôd recently read a book on the history of pinball with our daughter, and this museum brought that history to life for her in the flesh. No flippers? No problem - plunge and nudge. The original curator of the museum passed away in late 2022. It‚Äôs being managed with love by a volunteer and the curator‚Äôs son - and it‚Äôs a real treat to get to play these vintage games. Entry is on Saturdays by appointment only - check the website for details and plan ahead. If you like pinball, you‚Äôll love this place!

A hidden gem. After the passing away of Raphael last year, I was warmly received by Bruno and David. They gave me a brief introduction to the site. You pay 15 euros and have 220 machines to have fun with. When I was there, most machines were from the period 1930-1960, still there were some from the 70s, one from the 90s and three brand new.  Mandatory booking by e-mail, no more than 5 people per saturday (no large groups!)

I sold Rafael A 1958? Gottlieb Gypsy Queen, With a new NOS. Black class and brand new plastics., I‚Äôm in the US, what a gentleman to talk to. He told me he was going To leave all the pinballs in a museum, so the French authorities wouldn‚Äôt tax, I love that,

I am very sad to have only now discovered Monsieur Lankar's passing. I have only been to the Museum once but he was a very friendly gentleman with an inspiring passion for pinball. Only museum I've been to where the curators tell you to play with all the exhibits! I hope it continues and that I can visit you all again some day.

The museum open only saturday from 2:30 to 6:30 pm by individual appointement. Ask for a rendez-vous by mail one week in advance on the official website.  The family of Raphael LANKAR announces with great sorrow his passing on July 07, 2022.  He was surrounded by all his familly and close friends. Raphael is now in pinball heaven.

This museum is amazing. Raphael and Bruno literally opened the museum for us and accommodated our schedule. This museum is Raphael's life's work. He's been maintaining and restoring these machines since the 1960s. When you enter the museum and see the hundreds of perfectly maintained, vintage pinball machines and arcade games. You'll be in awe of what he has preserved. Raphael spent some time giving us a history of his place. He's a fascinating person whom I could have spoken to for hours, but he wanted to ensure my family had enough time to play the games.  My family, with 2 young boys, played non-stop for hours, and we had the whole museum to ourselves . . . while millions of tourists in Paris typically queued to take photos in front of statues. We felt guilty.  You should go if: - You have appreciation the mechanics of 20th century gaming - You have children who need to channel their video game addiction into something new - You looking to out-instagram your friends (the colorful pop of these machines is amazing)  and most importantly: - You love playing unlimited pinball (on perfectly maintained vintage machines)  This collection is an absolute treasure!

Super fine place. 200 oldschool pinball to play. 5 newage machines 1 Ms pacman.  15euro is a bargain if you are into pinball machines from 1930 and up.  Dont go if you are only into new age year 2000 and fourth.
We had an incredibly fun time at Paris Pinball - with 220 pinball machines! One more thing to love about living in Paris
I doubt I'll ever see as many pinball tables in one place again! The guide was helpful and ‚Ç¨15 for admission is a bargain. If you like pinball it's a must see.
So many beautiful machines!
Most amazing pinball place I have ever been
Best museum ever

Very beautiful private museum with a coherent and well-organized tour. The rooms are classified by brand of pinball and year, we see the evolution of the game, from its beginnings in the 1930s to its golden age at the end of the 70s. The machines are wonderfully well maintained and playable, the showrooms are clean and well lit. Finally, the owner of the place welcomes you with pleasure and remains available to answer your questions. It is a well-hidden treasure, absolutely worth discovering. These pinball machines are waiting for you!!! Splendid.

Five stars, nothing less! And if I could give ten, I would! This private museum is unknown to almost everyone, including many pinball lovers. And for good reason, Mr. Lankar, its boss and founder, does not seek to advertise too much. The result is that it "filters" the visitors a little and ensures that they do not take the place for a simple games room, but for a temple of electromechanical pinball. With my friend Frank M. (creator of the comic book character "Lucien"), we spent several hours there! The games from the '30s and early '40s are not the most fun, it becomes interesting from Humpty Dumpty from 1947 and its first "pinball machines" which allow you to control the ball. All the games are in perfect working order, it's a real pleasure, a return to childhood!

A great welcome and clear and interesting explanations on this incredible collection of more than 200 pinball machines. A very good afternoon. I strongly advise those who are fascinated by the history and beauty of the object, you will be served!

Magic! Not only is it very beautiful but also very warm welcome, a summary of the history of pinball / pinball machines on arrival then the museum and its some 200 "machines" is personally reserved for you for 4 hours. All of them are in very good condition and you can play them for free (after paying entry of course). You can also enjoy a jukebox and choose your period music, atmosphere guaranteed :-) Superb ‚Äúslot machines‚Äù also decorate the place, among many other things, it‚Äôs impossible to mention everything. In short, an extraordinary afternoon! Thanks for giving us this chance :-)
Very interesting. Don‚Äôt forget that you have to book a week in advance if you don‚Äôt want to find the door closed! it‚Äôs a private exhibition.

A truly unusual place for those who want to remember the good old days but also for young people who can discover the joy of playing pinball. Not to mention the history and collection side.  To visit!

A magnificent collection of many playable pinball machines in very good condition. Many slot machines too. A very beautiful place. Only one small regret, this collection ends at the beginning of the 70s, so there are no first electronics from the 80s with four counters. Very friendly welcome! I recommend the visit! Make an appointment on site.

Ali Baba's Cave Pin Ball version. If you were born in the 60s and 70s, and you were a fan of this type of games, this magical place will transport you back to your childhood as quickly as possible. Warm welcome from the hosts (Bruno in my case) who will explain the places and the history of the different machines to you. They even have a unit of the very first Pinball model equipped with pinball machines...... Honestly a unique place, built by enthusiasts for enthusiasts. To freak out üòâ.
Impressive to see so many pinball machines in such good condition. We had a wonderful time in the company of real enthusiasts.
Large collection of machines from people concerned about preserving the history of pinball
I will come back later because I show up and the museum was closed so very disappointed because the times are not clear enough to go there
Incredible collection of Pinball and a very nice visit by Mr Lankar! A must see!
Hello, he is an exceptional person, he is a very good customer, thank you
Many old pinball machines but too bad it stops in the 70s...
Unique!
A nice return to childhood.
Superb collection!
